intro: Aeollanthus heliotropioides, commonly known as the sun-like plant, is a flowering species native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It is known for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance and ability to attract pollinators. Aeollanthus heliotropioides is often cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic appeal and ecological benefits.
